snippet: An effort to require more public accounting of campaign money hit a roadblock in the Senate on Monday, but Democrats planned to keep pushing the issue.
abstract: Republican filibuster stops Senate from formally debating bill that would require more public accounting of campaign money, but Democrats eager to force more transparency in spending by independent groups like the secretive Commission on Hope, Growth and Opportunity plan to keep pushing the legislation.
